newsitem.title: USA: Acorn Venture Capital full results.
newsitem.headline: Acorn Venture Capital full results.

text.p: Three Months Ended Year Ended Year Ended
*Includes a loss of $1,430,885 as a result of a write-off due to a reserve established for a receivable from ServiceMax Tire & Auto Centers, Inc. ("ServiceMax"), a portfolio company.

Stephen A. Ollendorff, Chief Executive Officer of Acorn, stated that the net asset value increased during the year from $2.56 to $2.91 per share, due primarily to the increase in the fair market value of Recticon from $12,500,000 to $13,900,000. He noted, however, that the fair market value of Recticon had been reduced from $15,000,000 to $13,900,000 during the last quarter because of the deferral of certain customer orders of four-inch wafers to the latter half of 1997. However it was noted that Recticon was using its new equipment to solicit orders for five- and six-inch wafers. Shipments could potentially commence in June of 1997.

Mr. Ollendorff stated that the profit of Automotive for 1996 was largely due to a settlement with a third party and tax benefit allocation and that Automotive incurred losses from operations of approximately $250,000 for the 1996 fiscal year. Mr. Ollendorff added, however, that as a result of certain additional management changes, Automotive's goal was to achieve profitable operations in 1997.
